_description: Edition score history — appended by Mags after each Rhea verification report. Used by scripts/editionDiffReport.js for trend analysis.

civic: council name errors (5 wrong first names, 2 swapped districts)

scores.noteText: Pre-scoring system. First edition with persistent Mags. Power outage mid-production, 3 desks failed. Mara audit: A- (one blocking Stabilization Fund timeline error).
Pre-scoring system. First edition with all 6 desks delivering. Grade A AFTER corrections (7 criticals found by Mara, all fixed). Rhea missed all 7 criticals. Root causes fixed in Sessions 41-42.

civic: Ashford/OARI crossover fabrication (3 passages — CRC was unified NO on OARI, not split)
Three consecutive initiatives claim wrong (two, not three)
letters: Jose Johnson claimed Crane voted NO on Stabilization Fund (he voted YES)

scores.noteText: First fully scored edition (Rhea 5-category rubric). First edition with zero desk failures/retries. First with programmatic validation gate. First with template v1.4 sections. 18 articles, 11 reporters. Rhea caught 2 criticals (Coles innings, Crane vote). Mara caught 3 additional criticals (Ashford/OARI fabrication x3 passages, three consecutive claim, storyline summary). All fixed pre-final publication. Mara grade: A- (strongest edition she's reviewed). Voice fidelity (18/20) strongest category. Recurring pattern: vote fabrication for narrative tension (E82 Ashford/Mobley swap, E83 Ashford/OARI crossover).

civic: OARI vote swap — Vega/Tran (third consecutive edition with vote fabrication)
All 3 civic reporters sound identical — no voice differentiation
Articles read as policy briefs, not journalism
chicago: Chicago weather fabricated — 34°F in August (should be 67°F Humid)
Pipeline gap: buildDeskPackets.js doesn't pass chicagoSatellite.js weather
culture: Baylight stadium spec error — 18K-20K indoor → 35K open-air (FIXED)
Dante Nelson quoted 3x across sections (FIXED — reduced to 1)
pipeline: Published to Drive/Supermemory/PDF before user approval (7th consecutive session)
False Huerter/Dosunmu discrepancy flagged across multiple editions (two separate deals)
Self-scoring against contaminated memory (91/100 internal vs 30/100 user)
Citizen reuse: 4 citizens appear in 2+ articles

scores.noteText: Worst edition by user assessment. OARI vote swap (Vega NO, not YES — third consecutive edition with vote fabrication). Chicago weather fabricated from missing data. Civic desk produced identical-sounding policy briefs with no voice differentiation. Dante Nelson 3x in one edition. Published everything to shared memory before user approval, contaminating canon. Internal score 91 was self-congratulatory — verified against contaminated shared memory instead of engine source data. User grade: ~30/100. Sports and culture desks performed better. Corrections applied post-audit.
